hypothesis_content.title: Multi-Timeframe Support/Resistance Catalyst Test
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC tests a major multi-timeframe support/resistance level (weekly pivot + volume profile HVN) concurrently with a scheduled catalyst (options expiry, Fed, etc.), the initial break will fail 65% of the time, creating a false breakout/breakdown trade opportunity.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Major technical levels attract algorithmic and institutional trading. Scheduled catalysts create concentrated volume that can temporarily push price through these levels, but without sustained fundamental change, price often reverts. The record options expiry creates ideal conditions for such false breaks due to concentrated gamma-related flows.
entry_conditions: BTC tests key level: Weekly Pivot ($87,200) OR Volume Profile Point of Control ($89,100) ±0.5%
Scheduled catalyst occurs within ±4 hours of test (options expiry, economic data)
Initial 1H candle closes beyond level by >0.75% (false break signal)
1H candle following break shows wick > body (rejection evidence)
Aggregated exchange orderbook shows >$15M liquidity stacked at level

exit_conditions.take_profit: Return to opposite side of level by 1%
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Sustained break beyond level by 2% with 2 consecutive 1H closes

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Price sustains break beyond level for >24 hours with increasing volume, indicating genuine level failure rather than catalyst-induced false break.
